sn54.16:1.1.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinne kho te bhikkhū bhagavā etadavoca:
sn54.16:1.1.eng: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to them:

sn54.16:1.2.pli: “atthi nu kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato cattāro dhamme paripūreti, cattāro dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā satta dhamme paripūrenti, satta dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā dve dhamme paripūrentī”ti?
sn54.16:1.2.eng: “Mendicants, is there one thing that, when developed and cultivated, fulfills four things; and those four things, when developed and cultivated, fulfill seven things; and those seven things, when developed and cultivated, fulfill two things?”

sn54.16:1.3.pli: “Bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā …pe… bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
sn54.16:1.3.eng: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”

sn54.16:1.4.pli: “Atthi, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato cattāro dhamme paripūreti, cattāro dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā satta dhamme paripūrenti, satta dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā dve dhamme paripūrenti.

sn54.16:2.1.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato cattāro dhamme paripūreti, cattāro dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā satta dhamme paripūrenti, satta dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā dve dhamme paripūrenti?
sn54.16:2.1.eng: And what is that one thing?

sn54.16:2.2.pli: Ānāpānassatisamādhi, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato cattāro satipaṭṭhāne paripūreti, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā bhāvitā bahulīkatā satta bojjhaṅge paripūrenti, satta bojjhaṅgā bhāvitā bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrentīti.
sn54.16:2.2.eng: Immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is one thing that, when developed and cultivated, fulfills the four kinds of mindfulness meditation. And the four kinds of mindfulness meditation, when developed and cultivated, fulfill the seven awakening factors. And the seven awakening factors, when developed and cultivated, fulfill knowledge and freedom.

sn54.16:3.1.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvito ca, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi kathaṃ bahulīkato cattāro satipaṭṭhāne paripūreti?
sn54.16:3.1.eng: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated so as to fulfill the four kinds of mindfulness meditation?

sn54.16:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
sn54.16:3.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant—gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut—sits down cross-legged, sets their body straight, and establishes mindfulness in their presence. …

sn54.16:4.1.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dīghaṃ vā assasanto ‘dīghaṃ assasāmī’ti pajānāti, dīghaṃ vā passasanto ‘dīghaṃ passasāmī’ti pajānāti, rassaṃ vā assasanto ‘rassaṃ assasāmī’ti pajānāti …pe…

sn54.16:4.3.pli: ‘passambhayaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘passambhayaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ passasissāmī’ti sikkhati—

sn54.16:4.4.pli: kāye kāyānupassī, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

sn54.16:4.7.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, kāye kāyānupassī bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

sn54.16:5.4.pli: ‘passambhayaṃ cittasaṅkhāraṃ assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘passambhayaṃ cittasaṅkhāraṃ passasissāmī’ti sikkhati—

sn54.16:5.5.pli: vedanāsu vedanānupassī, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

sn54.16:5.7.pli: Vedanāññatarāhaṃ, bhikkhave, etaṃ vadāmi, yadidaṃ—assāsapassāsānaṃ sādhukaṃ manasikāraṃ.

sn54.16:5.8.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, vedanāsu vedanānupassī bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

sn54.16:6.3.pli: ‘samādahaṃ cittaṃ assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘samādahaṃ cittaṃ passasissāmī’ti sikkhati;

sn54.16:6.4.pli: ‘vimocayaṃ cittaṃ assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘vimocayaṃ cittaṃ passasissāmī’ti sikkhati—

sn54.16:6.5.pli: citte cittānupassī, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

sn54.16:6.7.pli: Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, muṭṭhassatissa asampajānassa ānāpānassatisamādhibhāvanaṃ vadāmi.

sn54.16:6.8.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, citte cittānupassī bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

sn54.16:7.5.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

sn54.16:7.6.pli: So yaṃ taṃ hoti abhijjhādomanassānaṃ pahānaṃ taṃ paññāya disvā sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti.

sn54.16:7.7.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, dhammesu dhammānupassī bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

sn54.16:8.1.pli: Evaṃ bhāvito kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi evaṃ bahulīkato cattāro satipaṭṭhāne paripūreti.

sn54.16:9.1.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā kathaṃ bahulīkatā satta bojjhaṅge paripūrenti?

sn54.16:9.2.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati—upaṭṭhitāssa tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno sati hoti asammuṭṭhā.

sn54.16:9.3.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā—

sn54.16:9.4.pli: satisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, satisambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, satisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

sn54.16:10.1.pli: So tathāsato viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṃsamāpajjati.

sn54.16:10.2.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathāsato viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṃsamāpajjati—

sn54.16:10.3.pli: dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

sn54.16:11.1.pli: Tassa taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinato pavicarato parivīmaṃsamāpajjato āraddhaṃ hoti vīriyaṃ asallīnaṃ.

sn54.16:11.2.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinato pavicarato parivīmaṃsamāpajjato āraddhaṃ hoti vīriyaṃ asallīnaṃ—

sn54.16:11.3.pli: vīriyasambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, vīriyasambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, vīriyasambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

sn54.16:12.2.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno āraddhavīriyassa uppajjati pīti nirāmisā—

sn54.16:12.3.pli: pītisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, pītisambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, pītisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

sn54.16:13.2.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pītimanassa kāyopi passambhati, cittampi passambhati—

sn54.16:13.3.pli: passaddhisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, passaddhisambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, passaddhisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

sn54.16:14.2.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno passaddhakāyassa sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati—

sn54.16:14.3.pli: samādhisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, samādhisambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, samādhisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

sn54.16:15.1.pli: So tathāsamāhitaṃ cittaṃ sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti.

sn54.16:15.2.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathāsamāhitaṃ cittaṃ sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti—

sn54.16:15.3.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

sn54.16:16.3.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati—upaṭṭhitāssa tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno sati hoti asammuṭṭhā.

sn54.16:16.4.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno upaṭṭhitā sati hoti asammuṭṭhā—

sn54.16:16.5.pli: satisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, satisambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti—satisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati …pe….

sn54.16:17.1.pli: So tathāsamāhitaṃ cittaṃ sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti.

sn54.16:17.2.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathāsamāhitaṃ cittaṃ sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti—

sn54.16:17.3.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

sn54.16:17.4.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā evaṃ bahulīkatā satta bojjhaṅge paripūrenti.

sn54.16:18.1.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā kathaṃ bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrenti?

sn54.16:18.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ;

sn54.16:18.3.pli: dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ …pe…

sn54.16:18.4.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.

sn54.16:18.5.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā evaṃ bahulīkatā vijjāvimuttiṃ paripūrentī”ti.
sn54.16:18.5.eng: That’s how the seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated so as to fulfill knowledge and freedom.”

sn54.17:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it leads to giving up the fetters …”

sn54.18:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it leads to uprooting the underlying tendencies …”

sn54.19:0.3.eng: Completely Understanding the Course of Time

sn54.19:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it leads to completely understanding the course of time …”

sn54.2:1.1.pli: “Ānāpānassati, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā.
sn54.2:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

sn54.2:1.2.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, ānāpānassati kathaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā?
sn54.2:1.2.eng: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?

sn54.2:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ānāpānassatisahagataṃ satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ,
sn54.2:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops mindfulness of breathing together with the awakening factors of mindfulness,

sn54.2:1.4.eng: investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,

sn54.2:1.5.pli: ānāpānassatisahagataṃ upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
sn54.2:1.5.eng: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

sn54.2:1.6.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassati evaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā”ti.
sn54.2:1.6.eng: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial.”

sn54.20:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it leads to the ending of defilements.

sn54.20:1.2.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvito ca, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi kathaṃ bahulīkato saṃyojanappahānāya saṃvattati …
sn54.20:1.2.eng: And how is immersion due to mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated so as to lead to giving up the fetters,

sn54.20:1.4.eng: completely understanding the course of time,

sn54.20:1.6.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā …pe…
sn54.20:1.6.eng: It’s when a mendicant—gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut—sits down cross-legged, sets their body straight, and establishes mindfulness in front of them. …

sn54.20:1.7.pli: paṭinissaggānupassī assasissāmīti sikkhati, paṭinissaggānupassī passasissāmīti sikkhati.
sn54.20:1.7.eng: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’

sn54.20:1.8.pli: Evaṃ bhāvito kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhi evaṃ bahulīkato saṃyojanappahānāya saṃvattati …pe…
sn54.20:1.8.eng: That’s how immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated so as to lead to giving up the fetters,

sn54.20:1.10.eng: completely understanding the course of time,

sn54.20:2.5.eng: The Linked Discourses on Mindfulness of Breathing is the tenth section.

sn54.3:1.1.pli: “Ānāpānassati, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā.
sn54.3:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

sn54.3:1.2.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, ānāpānassati kathaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā?
sn54.3:1.2.eng: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?

sn54.3:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
sn54.3:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant—gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut—sits down cross-legged, sets their body straight, and establishes mindfulness in their presence.

sn54.3:1.4.eng: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out. …

sn54.3:1.5.eng: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’

sn54.3:1.6.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassati evaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā”ti.
sn54.3:1.6.eng: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial.”

sn54.4:1.1.pli: “Ānāpānassati, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā.
sn54.4:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

sn54.4:1.2.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, ānāpānassati kathaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā?
sn54.4:1.2.eng: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?

sn54.4:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
sn54.4:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant—gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut—sits down cross-legged, sets their body straight, and establishes mindfulness in their presence.

sn54.4:1.4.eng: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out. …

sn54.4:1.5.eng: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’

sn54.4:1.6.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassati evaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā.
sn54.4:1.6.eng: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial.

sn54.4:1.7.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitāya kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatiyā evaṃ bahulīkatāya dvinnaṃ phalānaṃ aññataraṃ phalaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—
sn54.4:1.7.eng: When mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect one of two results:

sn54.4:1.8.pli: diṭṭheva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā”ti.
sn54.4:1.8.eng: enlightenment in this very life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”

sn54.5:1.1.pli: “Ānāpānassati, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā.
sn54.5:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

sn54.5:1.2.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, ānāpānassati kathaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā?
sn54.5:1.2.eng: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?

sn54.5:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
sn54.5:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant—gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut—sits down cross-legged, sets their body straight, and establishes mindfulness in their presence.

sn54.5:1.4.eng: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out. …

sn54.5:1.5.eng: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’

sn54.5:1.6.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassati evaṃ bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṃsā.
sn54.5:1.6.eng: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial.

sn54.5:2.1.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitāya kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatiyā evaṃ bahulīkatāya satta phalā sattānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
sn54.5:2.1.eng: When mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect seven fruits and benefits.

sn54.5:2.3.eng: You attain enlightenment early on in this very life.

sn54.5:2.4.pli: no ce diṭṭheva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti.

sn54.5:2.5.eng: If not, you attain enlightenment at the time of death.

sn54.5:2.6.pli: no ce diṭṭheva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti.

sn54.5:2.7.pli: Atha pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti …
sn54.5:2.7.eng: If not, with the ending of the five lower fetters you’re extinguished in between one life and the next …

sn54.5:2.11.eng: you head upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm …

sn54.5:2.12.pli: evaṃ bhāvitāya kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatiyā evaṃ bahulīkatāya ime satta phalā sattānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
sn54.5:2.12.eng: When mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect these seven fruits and benefits.”

sn54.6:1.3.eng: “Mendicants, do you develop mindfulness of breathing?”

sn54.6:1.4.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā ariṭṭho bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn54.6:1.4.eng: When he said this, Venerable Ariṭṭha said to him:

sn54.6:1.6.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, ariṭṭha, bhāvesi ānāpānassatin”ti?
sn54.6:1.6.eng: “But mendicant, how do you develop it?”

sn54.6:1.7.pli: “Atītesu me, bhante, kāmesu kāmacchando pahīno, anāgatesu me kāmesu kāmacchando vigato, ajjhattabahiddhā ca me dhammesu paṭighasaññā suppaṭivinītā.
sn54.6:1.7.eng: “Sir, I’ve given up desire for sensual pleasures of the past. I’m rid of desire for sensual pleasures of the future. And I have eliminated perception of repulsion regarding phenomena internally and externally.

sn54.6:1.8.eng: Just mindful, I will breathe in. Mindful, I will breathe out.

sn54.6:1.9.eng: That’s how I develop mindfulness of breathing.”

sn54.6:2.1.eng: “That is mindfulness of breathing, Ariṭṭha; I don’t deny it.

sn54.6:2.2.pli: Api ca, ariṭṭha, yathā ānāpānassati vitthārena paripuṇṇā hoti
sn54.6:2.2.eng: But as to how mindfulness of breathing is fulfilled in detail,

sn54.6:2.3.pli: taṃ suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
sn54.6:2.3.eng: listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

sn54.6:2.4.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ariṭṭho bhagavato paccassosi.

sn54.6:3.1.eng: “And how is mindfulness of breathing fulfilled in detail?

sn54.6:3.2.pli: Idha, ariṭṭha, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
sn54.6:3.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant—gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut—sits down cross-legged, sets their body straight, and establishes mindfulness in their presence.

sn54.6:3.3.eng: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out.

sn54.6:3.4.eng: Breathing in heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing in heavily.’ Breathing out heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing out heavily.’ …

sn54.6:3.5.eng: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’

sn54.6:3.6.pli: Evaṃ kho, ariṭṭha, ānāpānassati vitthārena paripuṇṇā hotī”ti.
sn54.6:3.6.eng: This is how mindfulness of breathing is fulfilled in detail.”

sn54.7:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākappino bhagavato avidūre nisinno hoti pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
sn54.7:1.2.eng: Now at that time Venerable Mahākappina was sitting not far from the Buddha, cross-legged, his body set straight, and mindfulness established in his presence.

sn54.7:1.3.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ mahākappinaṃ avidūre nisinnaṃ pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.

sn54.7:2.1.pli: “Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, etassa bhikkhuno kāyassa iñjitattaṃ vā phanditattaṃ vā”ti?
sn54.7:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, do you see any disturbance or trembling in that mendicant’s body?”

sn54.7:2.2.pli: “Yadāpi mayaṃ, bhante, taṃ āyasmantaṃ passāma saṅghamajjhe vā nisinnaṃ ekaṃ vā raho nisinnaṃ, tadāpi mayaṃ tassa āyasmato na passāma kāyassa iñjitattaṃ vā phanditattaṃ vā”ti.
sn54.7:2.2.eng: “Sir, whenever we see that mendicant meditating—whether in the middle of the Saṅgha or alone in private—we never see any disturbance or trembling in his body.”

sn54.7:3.1.pli: “Yassa, bhikkhave, samādhissa bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā neva kāyassa iñjitattaṃ vā hoti phanditattaṃ vā, na cittassa iñjitattaṃ vā hoti phanditattaṃ vā, tassa so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu samādhissa nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
sn54.7:3.1.eng: “Mendicants, when an immersion has been developed and cultivated there’s no disturbance or trembling of the body or mind. That mendicant gets such immersion when he wants, without trouble or difficulty.

sn54.7:3.2.pli: Katamassa ca, bhikkhave, samādhissa bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā neva kāyassa iñjitattaṃ vā hoti phanditattaṃ vā, na cittassa iñjitattaṃ vā hoti phanditattaṃ vā?

sn54.7:4.1.pli: Ānāpānassatisamādhissa, bhikkhave, bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā neva kāyassa iñjitattaṃ vā hoti phanditattaṃ vā, na cittassa iñjitattaṃ vā hoti phanditattaṃ vā.
sn54.7:4.1.eng: When immersion due to mindfulness of breathing has been developed and cultivated there’s no disturbance or trembling of the body or mind.

sn54.7:4.2.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvite ca, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhimhi kathaṃ bahulīkate neva kāyassa iñjitattaṃ vā hoti phanditattaṃ vā, na cittassa iñjitattaṃ vā hoti phanditattaṃ vā?
sn54.7:4.2.eng: And how is immersion due to mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated in such a way?

sn54.7:5.1.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
sn54.7:5.1.eng: It’s when a mendicant—gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut—sits down cross-legged, sets their body straight, and establishes mindfulness in their presence.

sn54.7:5.2.eng: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out. …

sn54.7:5.3.eng: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’

sn54.7:5.4.pli: Evaṃ bhāvite ca kho, bhikkhave, ānāpānassatisamādhimhi evaṃ bahulīkate neva kāyassa iñjitattaṃ vā hoti phanditattaṃ vā, na cittassa iñjitattaṃ vā hoti phanditattaṃ vā”ti.
sn54.7:5.4.eng: That’s how immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated so that there’s no disturbance or trembling of the body or mind.”
